item.title: Revance Has Commenced pII Study For RT001/RT1150 For Axillary Hyperhidrosis
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The study investigating Revance RT001 (now referred to as RTT150) a BoNT A topical gel, has commenced. The methodology will be a pII randomized double-blinded, placebo-controlled study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy in the treatment of primary axillary hyperhidrosis
The study will be conducted in the in the US with interim results expected end of 2015
Dan Browne President and CEO reported "Hyperhidrosis, or excessive sweating, is a widespread condition in a highly underserved market, representing a significant therapeutic opportunity for topical RT001. Botulinum toxin injections have been validated as an effective treatment, but not widely embraced. A big reason is the pain caused by the large number of required injections, up to fifteen per treated underarm. We believe our needle-free approach may provide a targeted, painless, and long-lasting alternative, without daily application or the systemic side effects observed in many other hyperhidrosis treatments. We also believe RT001 could dramatically expand the toxin market for excessive underarm sweating and bring new patients into the physician's office. Although this program's initial focus is on underarm hyperhidrosis, excessive sweating is often experienced in the palms, feet, and face. These represent potential future indications for us to pursue with RT001 topical gel."
Source: Revance

Comments
Revance today announced interim efficacy and safety results from its Phase II trial of RT001 topical botulinum toxin type A for the treatment of axilarry hyperhidrosis (excessive underarm sweating). The trial was designed to evaluate two doses of RT001 applied on a single day of treatment.
Revance announced that the data was positive using 'quantitative gravimetric measurements' (the trial sample size was not chosen to meet statistical significance), showing that a single treatment of RT001 topical gel achieved clinically meaningful efficacy at Week 4. Using the qualitative Hyperhidrosis Disease Severity Scale (HDSS), RT-001 showed a positive efficacy trend for both 1-point and 2-point improvement. Both doses appear to be safe and well tolerated.
In the details below, however, its is interesting to note that at week 4, using the primary qualitative efficacy assessment of 2-point improvement, though the trend is positive in absolute, the RT001 improvement in relatively inferior to placebo (14.3% to 13.3% for RT001 vs 29.4% for placebo)
Revance announced plans to advance RT001 to a larger hyperhidrosis Phase 2 study in 2016, to be designed to confirm a final dose. Following the larger Phase 2 trial, Revance plans to meet the FDA to take RT001 into Phase 3 studies.
Key interim results are as below:
  • On the primary quantitative assessment of average reduction from baseline in gravimetrically-measured sweat production, the results ranged from 214.2 mg to 165.7 mg (p=0.003 for the higher dose) per five minutes for RT001, compared to 66.3 mg per five minutes in patients who received placebo. These ranges corresponded to 81.1% to 79.6% change for RT001, compared to 54.6% for placebo.
  • On the primary qualitative efficacy assessment of a 2-point or greater responders from baseline using the HDSS, at Weeks 1 and 2 the results ranged from a 23.8% to 13.3 % improvement for RT001 compared to a range of 17.6% to 11.8% improvement for placebo. By Week 4, there was a 14.3% to 13.3% improvement for RT001, compared to a 29.4% improvement in patients who received placebo.
  • RT001 appears to be safe and well tolerated at both doses. Adverse events were generally mild, localized and transient. There were no serious adverse events or evidence of any systemic exposure for either of the two doses evaluated. The most common treatment-related adverse events reported were application site erythema (redness), folliculitis (razor bumps) and application site pain.

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Key Messages from Check Cap Presentation at Rodman & Renshaw Global Investment Conference
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Chek Cap develops the world's first diagnostic system for cleanse-free examination of the colon to identify precancerous polyps and cancers. Company claims that no prior bowel cleansing is needed because its x-rays create 360-degree angular scans that can "see through" intestinal content. Clinical trials are ongoing in Israel (6 sites)/EU (1 site). Management reported it expects to initiate U.S pivotal trial and launch the device in EU in H2:16.
Consists of ingestible X-ray scanning capsule, tracking system, processing software
18 granted, 1 allowed, and 29 pending from major juridictions including the U.S PTO, European Patent Organisation, China, Japan and India covering the core technology.
Financial position: $19M cash as of June 30, 2015
Principal investigators: GE, Fosun Pharma, Pontifax, Counterpoint
Founded: 2005 (US IPO in 2015)
Location: Israel; Boston
Employees: roughly 50

Comments
Check-Cap has reported that new data demonstrating safety and polyp detection from a clinical study evaluating the company's non-invasive system for preparation-free examination of the colon will be presented at the American College of Gastroenterology (ACG) Annual Scientific Meeting taking place October 16-21, 2015 and the United European Gastroenterology Week (UEGW) taking place October 24-28, 2015. The company anticipates submitting data from this study for CE Mark inQ1:16, and initiating a U.S. pivotal trial in H2:16.
About the Study
The study evaluated data from 49 volunteers and tracked the entire passage of the capsule through the alimentary tract using radio frequency telemetry and Check-Cap's proprietary capsule position tracking system.
All capsules were swallowed naturally without adverse events, and there was a 100% capsule excretion rate after an average transit time of 68 +/- 31 hours. Enrolled subjects were exposed to ultra-low doses of radiation with an average total exposure of 0.03 +/- 0.007 mSv (approximately equivalent to a single chest x-ray). Quantitative ultra-low dose x-ray 3D imaging was achieved in the colon of human subjects, and the system successfully generated multiple reconstructions of colon segments with polyps.
While colonic polyps were clearly demonstrated by the system, in order to get statistically significant results, the efficacy of this colon screening modality will need to be validated in a larger multi-center study.
These study results represent a preliminary analysis of the first patients evaluated in Check-Cap's ongoing multi-center clinical evaluation.

item.title: Highlights from the Next Third Microbiome R&D and Business Collaboration Forum
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The forum will take place Sept. 10-11 in San Diego, CA, USA and be attracting over 200 leading academics and industry experts. Among the sponsors, 4D pharma (platinum), P&G (silver), and Synthetic Biologics. Speakers with big pharma companies such as J&J, Novartis and Pfizer will be discussing, among other topics, the challenges of transforming bacteria into medicine, the promise and pitfalls of microbiome-modulating therapies for inflammatory and autoimmune diseases, and how to foster the growth of microbiome therapeutics. Presentations of Enterome Biosciences, 4D Pharma, Seres and Synthetic Biologics are outlined below.
Director of Inflammation and Immune Disorders, Seres Therapeutics
, Senior Vice President, Clinical & Regulatory Affairs, Synthetic Biologics will be presenting in the session 'Protecting the gut microbiome', SYN-004 which is designed to protect the gut microbiome from the effects of certain commonly used IV antibiotics for the prevention of C. difficile infection and antibiotic-associated diarrhea (AAD), and SYN-010 which is intended to reduce the impact of methane producing organisms in the gut microbiome to treat the underlying cause of irritable bowel syndrome with constipation (IBS-C).

item.title: Revance pII Clinical Trial To Treat Glabellar Lines With RT002 Has Completed Enrolment
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Phase II Clinical trial by Revance to assess the efficacy and safety of RT002 product has now completed recruitment
Estimated primary completion expected December 2015 with a completion date of March 2016. The study comprises of 5 study arms with varying doses including a comparator to placebo.
RT002 is an injectable BoNT A that is thought to offer a more targeted delivery and a longer-lasting effect than current BoNT A on the market.
Source: Clinicaltrial.gov NCT02303002

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: AstraZeneca Licences Starpharma Drug Delivery Platform To Co-Develop Cancer Compounds
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: AZ has agreed to license Starpharma DEP drug delivery platform to co-develop and co-commercialize oncology compounds against an unspecified 'defined family' of targets. AZ could pay up to $126 million for the first DEP product, and up to $94 million for each subsequent qualifying product plus royalties. The DEP platform uses Starpharma’s own dendrimers, with the aim of enhancing the dosing and efficacy characteristics of new drugs. Starpharma cited preclinical studies of DEP conjugates with a number of different cancer drugs, which the company said have already established improved efficacy and reduced toxicities compared to marketed versions.
Starpharma’s licensing agreement with AstraZeneca focuses on novel compounds, not on unmodified drugs in currently marketed formulations and is an expanding collaboration between the companies that first agreed to partner in September 2012, when the DEP drug delivery technology was applied to one important AstraZeneca oncology candidate.
Starpharma state that the licensing deal will not negatively impact other development programs, including its lead internal development candidate, a wholly-owned DEP docetaxel product. According to Starpharma, DEP docetaxel continues to demonstrate excellent tolerability and improved pharmacokinetics in the clinic compared with the available data for its reference drug, Taxotere.
Source: Starpharma PR

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: re: OTC Product for IBS-D to be Launched Next Month in the U.S
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
OTC Product for IBS-D to be Launched Next Month in the U.S 
Comment: IM HealthScience's IBgard is an encapsulated peppermint oil that reportedly works within 2 hours of administration to reduce symptoms of pain and urgency associated with IBS-D. Company claims that IBgard is the only medical food with SST (Site Specific Targeting) technology for the dieatary management of IBS. A poster with the results from the IBREST trial" was presented @ DDW 2015.  ...
Results of the IBREST trial have been published in Digestive Disease & Sciences. The conclusion outlines that the novel Peppermint oil (PO) formulation, designed for sustained release in the small intestine, is a safe, effective treatment capable of providing rapid relief of IBS symptoms.

Results

Seventy-two patients (mean age 40.7 years, 75 % female, 77.8 % white) were randomized to PO (n = 35) or placebo (n = 37). At 4 weeks, PO was associated with a 40 % reduction in the TISS from baseline (mean change −1.16, SD ± 0.807), superior to the 24.3 % decrease (mean change −0.70, SD ± 0.737) observed with placebo (P = 0.0246). The decrease in the TISS of 19.6 % (mean change −0.55, SD ± 0.613) in the PO group at 24 h was also significantly larger than placebo (−10.3 %, mean change −0.27, SD ± 0.342) (P = 0.0092). At trial completion, patients in the PO group experienced greater improvement in multiple individual gastrointestinal symptoms as well as in severe or unbearable symptoms, compared to placebo. PO was well tolerated with few adverse events.

Title: A Novel Delivery System of Peppermint Oil Is an Effective Therapy for Irritable Bowel Syndrome Symptoms

item.title: re: POC Study to Assess Abiraterone and Degarelix 1M Together
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
POC Study to Assess Abiraterone and Degarelix 1M Together 

Comment: Sponsored by the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center and ten collaborators among which J&J, this randomized, 3-arm trial will assess both drugs in combinaison as possible treatment for PSA recurrent prostate cancer, following definitive radical prostatectomy, as compared to abiraterone and degarelix alone. Primary endpoint will measure PFS.

  ...
Comment: Interestingly, the trial end date was initially postponed in March 2014 from Oct 2014 to Oct 2015. Again, the trial completion has now been postponed to Oct 2016 mainly due to opening of additional clinical sites in the US. This is still a proof of concept trial as the target patient remains quite small (n=120) for a 3 arm study. At this stage, the primary focus for J&J likely remains to ensure its ARN509 market entry. (Source: clinicaltrial.gov)

item.title: Incyte Inks An Acqusition of Anti-PD1 (SHR-1210) From Jiangsu Hengrui Medicine
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Incyte Announces Global License Agreement with Jiangsu Hengrui Medicine for SHR-1210, an Investigational Anti-PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody. Incyte to pay Hengrui $25 million upfront plus the potential for milestone and royalty payments . Under the agreement, Incyte will have the exclusive development and commercialization rights to SHR-1210 worldwide, with the exception of Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan. SHR-1210 is expected to enter proof-of-concept studies for the treatment of patients with advanced solid tumours in the coming months. Jiangsu Hengrui has a strong research focus in drug discovery for oncology targeted small molecule. It is one of the leading domestic manufactures for "China antineoplastic technological innovation and research alliance" that is one of the key Chinese government funded initiatives.
Company Profile
Jiangsu Hengrui Medicine Co., Ltd., established in 1970, is a fully integrated pharmaceutical company in China, with annual net sales of over U.S. $1.2 billion. Hengrui's products and innovative R&D span multiple therapeutic areas, including oncology and haematology, anaesthesiology and pain management, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases, contrast media, and inflammation.
Its Key Subsidiaries include:
  • Hengrui USA LLC (New Jersey): funded in 2005. R&D site for drug development and discovery, and commercialisation for ANDA, API in the US
  • Shanghai Hengrui Pharmaceuticals Co Ltd.: funded in 2000. Drug development site for IND drug discovery focusing on small molecule targeted therapy for oncology, CV, endocrinology
  • Three preclinical research centres in Shanghai, Chengdu, and JiangSu
Current Pipeline
Its current pipeline includes a multi-target angiogenesis inhibitor (anti-cKIT, anti-VEGF, anti-PDGFR) is also being evaluated in various GI malignancies (including colorectal cancer in Ph3, GIST and NET in Ph2). While Corporate Business Intelligence Team is aware of the initiation of the NET trial, however, the recruitment status for this trial still needs to be further validated.
* assets that are currently under evaluation in its Shanghai subsidiary
source: pharmaetrack
Incyte
Interestingly in July 2014, Incyte Corporation announced that it has entered into a clinical trial agreement with Genentech to evaluate the safety, tolerability and preliminary efficacy of Incyte’s oral indoleamine dioxygenase-1 (IDO1) inhibitor, INCB24360, in combination with Genentech’s PD-L1 immune checkpoint inhibitor, atezolizumab, in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). Under the terms of the collaboration, This is a non-exclusive collobaration to evaluate the combination. Incyte will be responsible for conducting the study and the results will be used to determine whether further clinical development of this combination is warranted. The acquisition of this anti-PD1 could allow Incyte to develop its combination strategy solely.
Source: GlobalData, Incyte Press Release, Jiangsu Hengrui Medicine Press Release

item.title: AstraZeneca to Support Clinical Bioinformatics Research
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: AstraZeneca and the U. of Manchester have announced a £11.5M collaboration harnessing clinical bioinformatics to deliver personalised healthcare for cancer patients. The five-year agreement will see the organisations apply clinical trial bioinformatics to better identify the right cancer treatment for the right patient at the right time.
The research will be carried out in partnership with the state-of-the-art clinical trials unit of The Christie NHS Foundation Trust, which is at the forefront of experimental cancer medicine in the UK.
Projects will include the development of a new bioinformatics system to capture and integrate clinical trial safety, efficacy, biomarker and drug distribution data in real time.
The collaboration will also support new training programs in clinical research and pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modelling for investigators to understand the distribution and clinical effects of medicines within the body.
Source: AstraZeneca

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: re: Novartis Has Launched the First Biosimilar in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Novartis Has Launched the First Biosimilar in the U.S. 
Comment: Sandoz has launched Zarxio (filgrastim-sndz) in the five indications to Amgen's Neupogen, the reference product. It is the first biosimilar approved by the FDA, and the first to launch in the U.S. With the product, the company offers Sandoz One SourceTM a patient services center, providing support that connects the patient to the information and resources they need.  ...
Comment: Novartis-Sandoz kicked off a new era in U.S. medicine with the launch at a discount of 15% to the original Neupogen (Amgen), The arrival of biosimilars threatens companies heavily reliant on biotech drugs, such as Amgen, AbbVie and Roche, and Citigroup analysts have predicted a transfer of at least $110 billion of value from innovator companies to copycat producers in the next decade. The 15 percent discount is the same price gap set when Zarxio was launched in Europe in 2009, although the discount in Europe has since widened to an average of around 20 to 30 percent. The US Insurers hope biosimilars will eventually cost the public 40 percent to 50 percent less than the original brands. (Source: Reuters)

item.title: New Countries Listed in the Ph2 of Enzalutamide for HCC
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Last May, Astellas outlined that enzalutamide is being evaluated in US and EU centers. New countries such as Canada, Taiwan, Hong Kong and South Korea have been added. In Europe, four countries have been listed such as UK, Italy, Spain, and France. The POC trial is expected to start next month, and complete Q1:18. PE will assess OS.
ID: NCT02528643
Recruitment: approx 144
Timelines: completion in January 2018

item.title: re: BioGaia Aligns Strategy Behind L.reuteri DSM 17938 for Necrotizing Enterocolitis (NEC)
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
BioGaia Aligns Strategy Behind L.reuteri DSM 17938 for Necrotizing Enterocolitis (NEC) 
Comment: BioGaia is evaluating the possibility of a separate listing of its subsidiary Infant Bacterial Therapeutics AB (IBT), which develops a prophylactic drug against NEC. To finance the first clinical trials (planned this year), IBT has an estimated capital need of approx. SEK 130 million. To enable BioGaia’s shareholders to invest directly in this project, the board of directors has instructed the management team to evaluate the possibility of a separate listing of IBT during the second half of 2015.  ...
BioGaia’s board of directors has resolved to invest a further SEK 35 million in the subsidiary Infant Bacterial Therapeutics AB (IBT), in addition to the approximately SEK 47 million previously decided. BioGaia’s total investment in IBT thus amounts to approx. SEK 82 million and its holding to 94.5%.
Efforts to evaluate the possibility for a separate listing of IBT are continuing.
IBT’s work is aimed at developing a unique orphan drug to prevent the fatal disease necrotising enterocolitis (NEC).
The project has progressed more rapidly than previously scheduled and according to the updated development plan, IBT expects to conduct two clinical trials within the next three years.
Source: BioGaia

item.title: re: NHS England Removes Drugs from Cancer Drugs Fund
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
NHS England Removes Drugs from Cancer Drugs Fund 
Comment: 23 treatments (16 drugs) will be removed from the NHS England Cancer Drugs Fund from 4 November 2015, among which PRRT (for advanced NETs), Radium-223 Dichloride (for CRPC). The NHS is to further examine the clinical criteria behind the inclusion of Cometriq (cabozantinib) and Caprelsa (vandetinib), both in the treatment of medullary thyroid cancer.  ...
Removing PRRT (Lutetium or Yttrium) from the Cancer Drugs Fund is the second NET treatment to be withdrawn this year, after the decision of delisting Everolimus back in April.


Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: NHS England Removes Drugs from Cancer Drugs Fund
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: 23 treatments (16 drugs) will be removed from the NHS England Cancer Drugs Fund from 4 November 2015, among which PRRT (for advanced NETs), Radium-223 Dichloride (for CRPC). The NHS is to further examine the clinical criteria behind the inclusion of Cometriq (cabozantinib) and Caprelsa (vandetinib), both in the treatment of medullary thyroid cancer.
The long-term future of the cancer fund remains unclear, especially whether it will be funded beyond its planned lifespan of 2016. With demand for these types of treatment remaining strong, there seemingly remains a need for dialogue regarding how many of these drugs are funded. For pharmaceutical companies there seems little scope for flexibility on pricing when the cost of development of biologics drugs (which the majority of these drugs are) is so high, and when the price of drugs in the UK remains a reference point for many other countries when conducting international reference price calculations. It seems that the dialogue therefore needs to concentrate on priorities for NHS funding, perhaps considering if funding should be reduced elsewhere to pay for these kinds of treatments, if a new fund should be established, or whether patient expectations as to access to life-extending medicines should be moderated
Source: from IHS GlobalInsight

Comments
Removing PRRT (Lutetium or Yttrium) from the Cancer Drugs Fund is the second NET treatment to be withdrawn this year, after the decision of delisting Everolimus back in April.

item.title: re: Cosmo's "Game Changer" Product Available for Licensing
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Cosmo's "Game Changer" Product Available for Licensing 
Comment: Alongside its 1H financial results, management has highlighted that the licensing process of SIC 8000, a sub-mucosal injectable composition for the extraction of polyps in the colon, will commence in Q4 2014. SIC 8000 is classified as a medical device with a very short regulatory approval path. Cosmo expects therefore to be able to launch the product in North America and the EU in H1 2015.  ...
FDA has approved Cosmo's request for marketing authorization of SIC 8000. According to the company, SIC 8000 will allow endoscopists to do their resection procedures safer and faster than before. Management now intends to conduct two marketing trials in order to have the product ready for marketing by the beginning of 2016. In the EU the request for marketing authorization filing was made on July 31st 2015 and with an approval expected in early 2016.

item.title: re: Cortendo's Strategy Disclosure While Planning For An IPO And Redomiciling The Parent Company to Ireland
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Cortendo's Strategy Disclosure While Planning For An IPO And Redomiciling The Parent Company to Ireland 
Comment: On July 20th Cortendo announced the plans to conduct an IPO in the US, due to complete in September 2015. More, on August 6th, Cortendo decided to redomicile the Cortendo Group’s parent company from Sweden to Ireland by means of an Exchange Offer, and its name to be changed to Strongbridge Biopharma Plc upon receipt of consent from the Irish registrar of companies. The Exchange Offer Prospectus discloses Cortendo’s detailed strategy on how to focus on rare endocrine disorders and in particular the development plans for COR-003, COR-004 and COR-005, the commercialization plans for the US and EU and the intention to expand its franchise on rare therapeutic areas through disciplined in-licensing and acquisitions.  ...
Cortendo confirmed that the company name has changed to Strongbridge Biopharma plc. and will become effective immediately with the new logo and corporate branding to be rolled out soon. Under the new corporate name, Strongbridge Biopharma remains committed to building a biopharmaceutical company focused on the development, in-licensing, acquisition and eventual commercialization of complementary product candidates across multiple franchises that target rare endocrine disorders and other rare diseases.


Comments
Strongbridge Biopharma plans for IPO did not go as originally planned: of the $86 million the biotech was hoping to raise when it filed the papers last month, it struggled to complete a $25 million listing on Nasdaq. Strongbridge had planned to allocate $12 million to the Phase III trial of COR-003, for Cushing's syndrome, a sum that would have seen the study through to completion. Now with just $5 million earmarked for the program, the company will only 'support' the continuation of the trial (currently recruiting). COR-003 is one of two key Phase III clinical trials ongoing for Cushing's syndrome. The other program in Phase III, LCI699 , is run by Novartis, and is also undergoing recruitment.

item.title: Recent Updates on Acino's Strategy
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Acino announed last Friday the US launch of its rivastigmine patch (for mild to moderate dementia associated with Alzheimer/Parkinson) by its licensing partner Alvogen. The patch is a generic version of Exelon fom Novartis. Acino has extensive expertise in transdermal drug delivery technologies; it is currently the second largest fentanyl patch manufacturer in Europe as well as the only generic buprenorphine patch producer. In addition, recent external intelligence has confirmed that the goserelin Ph3 trials have been terminated due to stability issues. It is believed that the leuprorelin platform was in-licensed by AMW, and that .
Leuprorelin is a priority for the company, who will require a partner for its commercialisation.
The goserelin 1M was delayed due to various issues, including recruitment, manufacturing and logistics. Data are xpected by Q1:16, with an earliest filing in 2H2016.
§AMW is funded by a mix of Dr. Wilfried Fischer’s own capital and VC investment
§Prior to the foundation of AMW GmbH, Dr. Fischer founded, Novosis AG (implant/patch technology) in 1997 which he sold to the Swiss Schweizerhall Group who changed their name to Acino in 2008. It is understood Dr. Fischer still works in an advisory capacity to Acino
§Recently received a total of 5 million Euros of new financing
§Hoping to see profit in 2016
§Currently employees 26 people with the aim to increase by an additional 30 (by end of 2017)

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Amgen And Novartis Enter Into A Global Partnership in Neuroscience Treatments
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Amgen and Novartis have announced a global partnership to co-develop treatments for Alzheimer’s disease and migraine.
This global partnership includes the combination of each companies BACE programs, including Novartis’ inhibitor CNP520.
Amgen will make upfront and milestone payments to Novartis in addition to 50/50 cost and profit share arrangement. Novartis will acquire global co-development rights and commercial rights outside of the US, Canada and Japan to Amgen’s migraine portfolio.
Vas Narasimhan Novartis' global head of development reported that this collaboration “"Allows us to share risk on the Alzheimer's programme. While there's a tremendous unmet need clinical trials are long, endpoints are still unknown and mechanisms underlying the disease are still something we're all trying to work out."
Sean Harper, executive vice president of R&D at Amgen reported that "We are very pleased to be joining forces with Novartis on two important neuroscience programmes where there remains high unmet medical need. Our collaboration on BACE inhibition reflects Amgen's strategic focus on genetically validated drug candidates while our collaboration in migraine creates an opportunity to more rapidly advance AMG 334 on a global scale."
Source: Firstword

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Novartis Has Launched the First Biosimilar in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Sandoz has launched Zarxio (filgrastim-sndz) in the five indications to Amgen's Neupogen, the reference product. It is the first biosimilar approved by the FDA, and the first to launch in the U.S. With the product, the company offers Sandoz One SourceTM a patient services center, providing support that connects the patient to the information and resources they need.
Sandoz currently markets three biosimilars outside the US: Omnitrope®, Binocrit® and Zarzio®
Pipeline

Comments
Comment: Novartis-Sandoz kicked off a new era in U.S. medicine with the launch at a discount of 15% to the original Neupogen (Amgen), The arrival of biosimilars threatens companies heavily reliant on biotech drugs, such as Amgen, AbbVie and Roche, and Citigroup analysts have predicted a transfer of at least $110 billion of value from innovator companies to copycat producers in the next decade. The 15 percent discount is the same price gap set when Zarxio was launched in Europe in 2009, although the discount in Europe has since widened to an average of around 20 to 30 percent. The US Insurers hope biosimilars will eventually cost the public 40 percent to 50 percent less than the original brands. (Source: Reuters)

item.title: A Publication In BJUI Showed Hexvix® Has No Budget Impact On The Lifetime Costs
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Photocure has made an annoucement that a newly published article in BJUI showing that Hexvix has not budget impact on the liftetime costs in Sweden. The analysis shows that, even with conservative estimates of clinical effectiveness, a single Hexvix instillation for each patient is likely to be cost neutral or cost negative over 5 years, compared with white-light cystoscopy.
The objective of the study is to explore the cost impact on Swedish healthcare of incorporating one instillation of HEXVIX into the transurethral resection of bladder tumours in patients with suspected new or recurrent non muscle invasive bladder. This is a Photocure funded publication.
Source: Photocure Press Release, Rose James et al. BJU Internation (2015 Aug Full text link available in PERAL)

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Astellas to Develop Mirabegron in Ped Setting for NDO or OAB
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The new Ph1 will evaluate PK (primary endpoint), safety and tolerability of mirabegron oral suspension. The study will be starting Q4:15 when the other Ph1 testing mirabegron Oral Controlled Absorption System is complete. On top of the ped indications, Astellas aims at developing combo trial with Vesicare.
Study reference NCT02526979
Timelines: from Nov 2015 to June 2016 (primary completion date)
Location: EU; US

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Recruitment has completed for phase IIII Xeomin study, SIAXI, in Sialorrhoea
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Merz phase III study investigating Xeomin in various neurological conditions for the treatment of chronic troublesome sialorrhea has now completed recruitment, with a primary completion expected in December 2015
The study Clinical Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of Two Dose Levels of NT 201 Versus Placebo in Treating Chronic Troublesome Sialorrhea in Various Neurological Conditions (SIAXI) has completed recruitment. The neurological conditions investigated include Parkinson's Disease, Post-stroke and Traumatic Brain Injury. The primary completion date is expected in December 2015 and the completion date, November 2016.
The treatment arms are 100 units and 75 units with study locations in Germany and Poland.
Source: Clinicaltrials.gov NCT02091739

item.title: re: Allergan To Purchase Naurex As They Continue To Strengthen Their Neurology Portfolio
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Allergan To Purchase Naurex As They Continue To Strengthen Their Neurology Portfolio 
Comment: Allergan has entered into an agreement to purchase Naurex for $560 million which will continue to strengthen Allergan’s long-term growth profile.  ...
Allergan has now completed the acquisition of Naurex with the payment of $460 million with a further $100 million payable by January of 2016, as well as potential R&D success-based and sales-threshold milestone payments.
Brent Saunders CEO discussed "The acquisition of Naurex enhances our ability to be among the leaders in the development of novel, game-changing therapies in mental health. This is an area of medicine that requires new ways to tackle some of society's most challenging diseases and disorders. Naurex's unique pipeline includes GLYX-13 and NRX-1074, two compounds that utilize NMDA modulation as a potential new approach to the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). We have geared up to advance the development of these compounds into the next phase of clinical trials."
This acquisition further strengthens Allergan’s late stage program in mental health
Source: Allergan
